通信数学理论的一些最新贡献

Some Recent Contributions to the Mathematical Theory of Communication

沃伦·韦弗
Warren Weaver

通信的数学理论

The Mathematical Theory of Communication

克劳德·E·香农
Claude E. Shannon

1. 离散无噪声系统
1. Discrete Noiseless Systems
2. 带噪声的离散通道
2. The Discrete Channel with Noise

5. 连续源的速率

前言

Foreword

故事讲的是，年轻的所罗门王被赋予了财富和智慧的选择。当他选择智慧时，上帝非常高兴，不仅赐予所罗门智慧，还赐予他财富。科学也是如此。
The story is told that young King Solomon was given the choice between wealth and wisdom. When he chose wisdom, God was so pleased that he gave Solomon not only wisdom but wealth also. So it is with science.
—阿瑟·霍利·康普顿
—Arthur Holly Compton

半个世纪前，即 1948 年，克劳德·香农发表了他的巨作《通信的数学理论》。这篇论文随后于 1949 年由伊利诺伊大学出版社以书籍形式重新出版，并附有沃伦·韦弗的说明性介绍。1948 年至 1949 年间书名的细微变化既微不足道又意义深远。这篇论文以及这本书对技术进步以及我们现在所知道的生活产生了巨大影响。尽管这本书具有专业性，但它已售出 40,000 多本，并且每年仍售出 700 多本。它是许多信息理论课程的必读书籍。我们很高兴能为这个 50 周年纪念版的出版贡献一份力量，除了纠正了四次精装和十六次平装印刷中存在的一些小印刷错误外，该书与原版完全相同。

A half century ago, in 1948, Claude Shannon published his epic paper “A Mathematical Theory of Communication.” This paper was thereafter republished in book form in 1949 by the University of Illinois Press, together with an expository introduction by Warren Weaver. The slight change in the title between 1948 and 1949 is both trivial and profound. The paper and, by extension, the book have had an immense impact on technological progress, and so on life as we now know it. Despite its specialized character, the book has sold more than 40,000 copies and continues to sell 700 or more copies per year. It is required reading in many courses on information theory. We are delighted to have a small role in the publication of this golden anniversary edition, which is identical to the original except for the correction of a number of minor typographical errors that have existed through four hard cover and sixteen paperback printings.

在这部重要的著作中，香农选择了一种轻柔的笔触和温和的表达方式，这种表达方式在当时的技术论文中比在我们自己的论文中更常见。他深刻地洞察了通信问题的本质，并选择以自己的方式和最少的数学证明来传达这种智慧。也许这就是这部作品永恒品质的基础。虽然证明来自其他地方，而且后来也出现了，但洞察力却闪耀着光芒。衡量这本书伟大之处的一个标准是，香农的主要原则是，所有通信本质上都是数字化的，如今已成为人们的普遍共识。现代数字文学中，甚至许多人都想知道香农为什么要陈述如此明显的公理。然而，50 年前他的读者对他的作品持怀疑和冷漠的态度。

In this important work, Shannon chose to use a light touch and a gentle delivery more common in technical papers of that time than in our own. He saw deeply into the essence of the communication problem and chose to deliver that wisdom in his own way and with a minimum of mathematical proof. Perhaps this underlies the timeless quality of the work. The proofs came elsewhere and later, but the insight shines through. One measure of the greatness of the book is that Shannon's major precept that all communication is essentially digital is now commonplace among the modern digitalia, even to the point where many wonder why Shannon needed to state such an obvious axiom. Yet his audience fifty years ago took a somewhat skeptical and aloof view of his work.

香农有先见之明，将通信主题明确划分为源、源编码器、信道编码器、信道以及相关的信道和源解码器。尽管他的形式化在我们这个时代似乎非常明显，但在当时却并不那么明显。香农进一步发现，可以而且应该使用熵和条件熵的概念来描述信道和源。他通过直观公理和精确编码定理的描述，有力地论证了这些概念的使用。此外，他还指出，可以使用熵和涉及熵的函数最大化来识别非常明确、具有操作意义的概念，例如源的信息内容或信道的信息容量。

Shannon had the presight to overlay the subject of communication with a distinct partitioning into sources, source encoders, channel encoders, channels, and associated channel and source decoders. Although his formalization seems quite obvious in our time, it was not so obvious back then. Shannon further saw that channels and sources could and should be described using the notions of entropy and conditional entropy. He argued persuasively for the use of these notions, both through their characterization by intuitive axioms and by presentation of precise coding theorems. Moreover, he indicated how very explicit, operationally significant concepts such as the information content of a source or the information capacity of a channel can be identified using entropy and maximization of functions involving entropy.

香农的革命性工作使信息理论这一新学科完全成型，但需要经过五十年的成熟才能成熟。很难想象如何以进化的方式创造出这一学科，尽管在概念提出之后，它的进化在数百位作者的手中继续进行，最终形成了目前成熟的学科。

Shannon's revolutionary work brought forth this new subject of information theory fully formed but waiting for the maturity that fifty years of aging would bring. It is hard to imagine how the subject could have been created in an evolutionary way, though after the conception its evolution proceeded in the hands of hundreds of authors to produce the subject in its current state of maturity.

沃伦·韦弗在本书前言中所做的阐述是他为促进广大读者理解科学和数学而做出的众多贡献之一。它说明了香农的思想所产生的影响（至少在五十年前）远远超出了通信工程师和香农本人的直接目标。这些影响包括语言学家和社会科学家在解决广泛通信问题时所获得的见解。

The exposition by Warren Weaver that introduces the book is one of his many and diverse contributions toward promoting the understanding of science and mathematics to a broad audience. It illustrates how Shannon's ideas have implications that were (at least fifty years ago) well beyond the immediate goals of communication engineers and of Shannon himself. These include insights for linguists and for social scientists addressing broad communication issues.

香农的信息理论对电信发展的影响是巨大的。对于那些处于发展前沿的人来说，这一点是显而易见的，但对于那些参与常规设计的人来说，这一点可能不那么明显。信道具有特定的信息容量，可以以每秒比特数来衡量，这一概念产生了深远的影响。一方面，这这一概念至少在理论上有望实现通信系统，即对于给定信道，对于任何小于信道容量的数据速率，其错误频率尽可能小。此外，香农的相关存在性证明提供了诱人的见解，让我们了解理想通信系统有朝一日如何实现这一承诺。另一方面，这一概念还明确规定了信道上可以实现的通信速率的极限，为通信工程师提供了最终基准，以此来校准针对给定信道构建最终通信系统的进度。

The impact of Shannon's theory of information on the development of telecommunication has been immense. This is evident to those working at the edge of advancing developments, though perhaps not quite so visible to those involved in routine design. The notion that a channel has a specific information capacity, which can be measured in bits per second, has had a profound influence. On the one hand, this notion offers the promise, at least in theory, of communication systems with frequency of errors as small as desired for a given channel for any data rate less than the channel capacity. Moreover, Shannon's associated existence proof provided tantalizing insight into how ideal communication systems might someday fulfill the promise. On the other hand, this notion also clearly establishes a limit on the communication rate that can be achieved over a channel, offering communication engineers the ultimate benchmark with which to calibrate progress toward construction of the ultimate communication system for a given channel.

可以达到特定容量，并且没有数据传输系统可以超过该容量，这一事实在过去五十年中一直是调制解调器设计的圣杯。如果没有香农容量公式的指导，调制解调器设计师会更经常地跌倒，进展会更慢。从深空卫星链路到磁带和无处不在的光盘等存储设备，从高速互联网到广播高清电视等通信系统，都因为他的工作而更早、更好地出现。除了这些丰富的后果之外，克劳德·香农的洞察力智慧最终可能是他最伟大的遗产。

The fact that a specific capacity can be reached, and that no data transmission system can exceed this capacity, has been the holy grail of modem design for the last fifty years. Without the guidance of Shannon's capacity formula, modem designers would have stumbled more often and proceeded more slowly. Communication systems ranging from deep-space satellite links to storage devices such as magnetic tapes and ubiquitous compact disks, and from high-speed internets to broadcast high-definition television, came sooner and in better form because of his work. Aside from this wealth of consequences, the wisdom of Claude Shannon's insights may in the end be his greatest legacy.

Richard E. Blahut

布鲁斯·哈杰克
Richard E. Blahut

Bruce Hajek

前言

Preface

近年来，国内外许多学者在通信理论方面开展了大量研究。鉴于人们对该领域的广泛兴趣，院长 LN Ridenour 建议出版本卷，其中包含两篇有关该主题的论文。

Recent years have witnessed considerable research activity in communication theory by a number of workers both here and abroad. In view of the widespread interest in this field, Dean L. N. Ridenour suggested the present volume consisting of two papers on this subject.

第一篇论文之前从未以现在的形式发表过，尽管 1949 年 7 月的《科学美国人》杂志刊登了一篇摘要。在进入更数学的方面之前，它首先对该领域的全景进行了说明性介绍。此外，还提出了一些想法，以更广泛地应用通信理论的基本原理。

The first paper has not previously been printed in its present form, although a condensation appeared in Scientific American, July, 1949. In part, it consists of an expository introduction to the panoramic view of the field before entering into the more mathematical aspects. In addition, some ideas are suggested for broader application of the fundamental principles of communication theory.

第二篇论文摘自1948 年 7 月和 10 月的《贝尔系统技术期刊》，除纠正了一些小错误和添加了一些额外的参考资料外，没有任何变化。我们计划在一份涉及信息理论更一般方面的计划工作中讨论该领域的后续发展。

The second paper is reprinted from the Bell System Technical Journal, July and October, 1948, with no changes except the correction of minor errata and the inclusion of some additional references. It is intended that subsequent developments in the field will be treated in a projected work dealing with more general aspects of information theory.

我们非常高兴地向 Dean Ridenour 表示感谢，感谢他促成了本书的出版，并向伊利诺伊大学出版社的出色合作表示感谢。

It gives us pleasure to express our thanks to Dean Ridenour for making this book possible and to the University of Illinois Press for their splendid cooperation.

CE Shannon

W. Weaver
C. E. Shannon

W. Weaver

通信数学理论的最新贡献

RECENT CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE MATHEMATICAL THEORY OF COMMUNICATION

沃伦·韦弗

By Warren Weaver

1

1

关于分析传播学1的一般背景的介绍

Introductory Note on the General Setting of the Analytical Communication Studies1

1.1. 沟通

1.1. Communication

这里将以非常广泛的意义使用“沟通”一词，它包括一种思想影响另一种思想的所有过程。当然，这不仅涉及书面和口头语言，还涉及音乐、绘画艺术、戏剧、芭蕾舞，事实上还包括所有人类行为。在某些情况下，可能需要使用更广泛的沟通定义，即包括一种机制（例如跟踪飞机并计算其可能的未来位置的自动设备）影响另一种机制（例如追踪这架飞机的制导导弹）的过程。

The word communication will be used here in a very broad sense to include all of the procedures by which one mind may affect another. This, of course, involves not only written and oral speech, but also music, the pictorial arts, the theatre, the ballet, and in fact all human behavior. In some connections it may be desirable to use a still broader definition of communication, namely, one which would include the procedures by means of which one mechanism (say automatic equipment to track an airplane and to compute its probable future positions) affects another mechanism (say a guided missile chasing this airplane).

本备忘录的措辞经常似乎是指言论传播这一特殊但仍然非常广泛和重要的领域；但实际上所说的一切都适用对于任何类型的音乐，以及电视等静态或动态图像，都同样适用。

The language of this memorandum will often appear to refer to the special, but still very broad and important, field of the communication of speech; but practically everything said applies equally well to music of any sort, and to still or moving pictures, as in television.

1.2. 三个层次的沟通问题

1.2. Three Levels of Communications Problems

相对于沟通这个大主题，似乎存在三个层面的问题。因此，似乎有必要依次提出以下问题：

Relative to the broad subject of communication, there seem to be problems at three levels. Thus it seems reasonable to ask, serially:

级别A. 通信符号的传输准确度如何？（技术问题。）

LEVEL A. How accurately can the symbols of communication be transmitted? (The technical problem.)

级别B.所传输的符号如何精确地传达所需的含义？（语义问题。）

LEVEL B. How precisely do the transmitted symbols convey the desired meaning? (The semantic problem.)

级别C. 所接收的含义如何有效地以期望的方式影响行为？（有效性问题。）

LEVEL C. How effectively does the received meaning affect conduct in the desired way? (The effectiveness problem.)

技术问题涉及从发送方到接收方的符号集（书面语音）、连续变化的信号（电话或无线电传输的声音或音乐）或连续变化的二维模式（电视）等的传输的准确性。从数学上讲，第一个问题涉及有限集离散符号的传输，第二个问题涉及一个连续时间函数的传输，第三个问题涉及多个连续时间函数或一个连续时间函数和两个空间坐标的传输。

The technical problems are concerned with the accuracy of transference from sender to receiver of sets of symbols (written speech), or of a continuously varying signal (telephonic or radio transmission of voice or music), or of a continuously varying two-dimensional pattern (television), etc. Mathematically, the first involves transmission of a finite set of discrete symbols, the second the transmission of one continuous function of time, and the third the transmission of many continuous functions of time or of one continuous function of time and of two space coordinates.

语义问题涉及接收者对意义的解释是否与发送者的本意相符，或是否足够接近。即使只处理相对简单的语音交流问题，这也是一个很深奥、很复杂的问题。

The semantic problems are concerned with the identity, or satisfactorily close approximation, in the interpretation of meaning by the receiver, as compared with the intended meaning of the sender. This is a very deep and involved situation, even when one deals only with the relatively simpler problems of communicating through speech.

一个重要的复杂因素是，如果怀疑 X 先生不理解 Y 先生说的话，那么理论上不可能让 Y 先生什么都不做，只是与 X 先生进一步交谈，从而在有限的时间内完全澄清这种情况。如果 Y 先生说“你现在明白我的意思了吗？”而 X 先生说“当然，我明白了”，这并不一定意味着双方已经理解了。可能只是 X 先生没有理解这个问题。如果这听起来很愚蠢，请尝试再次将其改为“Czy pa mnie rozumie?”，答案是“Hai wakkate imasu”。我认为，至少在有限的言语交流领域中，这个基本困难2可以通过“解释”减少到可以容忍的程度（但从未完全消除），这些“解释” (a) 大概永远不会超过所解释想法的近似值，但 (b) 是可以理解的，因为它们是用之前已经通过操作手段相当清晰的语言表达的。例如，用任何语言表达“是”的符号都不需要很长时间就可以在操作上理解。

One essential complication is illustrated by the remark that if Mr. X is suspected not to understand what Mr. Y says, then it is theoretically not possible, by having Mr. Y do nothing but talk further with Mr. X, completely to clarify this situation in any finite time. If Mr. Y says “Do you now understand me?” and Mr. X says “Certainly, I do,” this is not necessarily a certification that understanding has been achieved. It may just be that Mr. X did not understand the question. If this sounds silly, try it again as “Czy pa mnie rozumie?” with the answer “Hai wakkate imasu.” I think that this basic difficulty2 is, at least in the restricted field of speech communication, reduced to a tolerable size (but never completely eliminated) by “explanations” which (a) are presumably never more than approximations to the ideas being explained, but which (b) are understandable since they are phrased in language which has previously been made reasonably clear by operational means. For example, it does not take long to make the symbol for “yes” in any language operationally understandable.

如果从一般意义上考虑交流，语义问题会产生广泛影响。例如，考虑一下美国新闻片对俄罗斯人的意义。

The semantic problem has wide ramifications if one thinks of communication in general. Consider, for example, the meaning to a Russian of a U.S. newsreel picture.

有效性问题与传达给接收者的意义是否能成功导致接收者采取所期望的行为有关。乍一看，暗示所有沟通的目的都是影响接收者的行为似乎过于狭隘。但根据任何合理广泛的行为定义，很明显，沟通要么影响行为，要么根本不会产生任何可察觉和可能的效果。

The effectiveness problems are concerned with the success with which the meaning conveyed to the receiver leads to the desired conduct on his part. It may seem at first glance undesirably narrow to imply that the purpose of all communication is to influence the conduct of the receiver. But with any reasonably broad definition of conduct, it is clear that communication either affects conduct or is without any discernible and probable effect at all.

就美术而言，有效性问题涉及美学考量。就书面或口头演讲而言，它涉及的考量范围从单纯的风格技巧，到宣传理论的所有心理和情感方面，再到那些为本节关于有效性的开篇句中的“成功”和“期望”这两个词赋予有用意义所必需的价值判断。

The problem of effectiveness involves aesthetic considerations in the case of the fine arts. In the case of speech, written or oral, it involves considerations which range all the way from the mere mechanics of style, through all the psychological and emotional aspects of propaganda theory, to those value judgments which are necessary to give useful meaning to the words “success” and “desired” in the opening sentence of this section on effectiveness.

有效性问题与语义问题紧密相关，并且以一种相当模糊的方式相互重叠；事实上，所有建议的问题类别之间都有重叠。

The effectiveness problem is closely interrelated with the semantic problem, and overlaps it in a rather vague way; and there is in fact overlap between all of the suggested categories of problems.

1.3. 评论

1.3. Comments

这样说来，人们倾向于认为 A 级是相对肤浅的级，仅涉及良好通信系统设计的工程细节；而 B 和 C 级似乎包含了通信一般问题的大部分（如果不是全部）哲学内容。

So stated, one would be inclined to think that Level A is a relatively superficial one, involving only the engineering details of good design of a communication system; while B and C seem to contain most if not all of the philosophical content of the general problem of communication.

通信工程方面的数学理论，主要由克劳德·香农在贝尔电话实验室开发，诚然，它首先仅适用于问题 A，即从发送方到接收方的各种信号传输的准确性技术问题。但我认为，该理论具有深刻的意义，证明了前一段是严重不准确的。新理论的部分意义来自这样一个事实：上面的 B 和 C 级只能利用在 A 级分析时可能实现的信号精度。因此，在 A 级理论中发现的任何局限性必然适用于 B 和 C 级。但更重要的意义来自这样一个事实：A 级的分析表明，该级与其他级的重叠程度超过了人们可能天真的怀疑。因此，A 级理论至少在很大程度上也是 B 和 C 级理论。我希望本备忘录的后续部分将阐明并证明这些最后的观点。

The mathematical theory of the engineering aspects of communication, as developed chiefly by Claude Shannon at the Bell Telephone Laboratories, admittedly applies in the first instance only to problem A, namely, the technical problem of accuracy of transference of various types of signals from sender to receiver. But the theory has, I think, a deep significance which proves that the preceding paragraph is seriously inaccurate. Part of the significance of the new theory comes from the fact that levels B and C, above, can make use only of those signal accuracies which turn out to be possible when analyzed at Level A. Thus any limitations discovered in the theory at Level A necessarily apply to levels B and C. But a larger part of the significance comes from the fact that the analysis at Level A discloses that this level overlaps the other levels more than one could possible naively suspect. Thus the theory of Level A is, at least to a significant degree, also a theory of levels B and C. I hope that the succeeding parts of this memorandum will illuminate and justify these last remarks.

2

2

A 级沟通问题

Communication Problems at Level A

2.1. 通信系统及其问题

2.1. A Communication System and Its Problems

考虑的通信系统可以用以下符号表示：

The communication system considered may be symbolically represented as follows:

信息源从一组可能的消息中选出所需的消息（这是非常重要的一点，后面需要详细解释）。所选消息可能由书面或口头文字组成，也可能由图片、音乐等组成。

The information source selects a desired message out of a set of possible messages (this is a particularly important remark, which requires considerable explanation later). The selected message may consist of written or spoken words, or of pictures, music, etc.

发射机将此信息转换为信号，该信号实际上通过通信信道从发射机发送到接收机。在电话技术中，信道是一根电线，信号是这根电线上的变化的电流；发射机是一组设备（电话发射机等），它们将声音的声压转换为变化的电流。在电报技术中，发射机将书面文字编码为长度不一的间断电流序列（点、划、空格）。在口语中，信息源是大脑，发射机是产生变化声压（信号）的语音机制，并通过空气（信道）传输。在无线电中，信道就是空间（或者以太，如果有人仍然喜欢这个过时且具有误导性的词的话），信号就是传输的电磁波。

The transmitter changes this message into the signal which is actually sent over the communication channel from the transmitter to the receiver. In the case of telephony, the channel is a wire, the signal a varying electrical current on this wire; the transmitter is the set of devices (telephone transmitter, etc.) which change the sound pressure of the voice into the varying electrical current. In telegraphy, the transmitter codes written words into sequences of interrupted currents of varying lengths (dots, dashes, spaces). In oral speech, the information source is the brain, the transmitter is the voice mechanism producing the varying sound pressure (the signal) which is transmitted through the air (the channel). In radio, the channel is simply space (or the aether, if any one still prefers that antiquated and misleading word), and the signal is the electromagnetic wave which is transmitted.

接收器是一种反向发射器，它将传输的信号重新转换为信息，并将该信息传递给目的地。当我和你说话时，我的大脑是信息源，你的大脑是目的地；我的发声系统是发射器，你的耳朵和相关的第八神经是接收器。

The receiver is a sort of inverse transmitter, changing the transmitted signal back into a message, and handing this message on to the destination. When I talk to you, my brain is the information source, yours the destination; my vocal system is the transmitter, and your ear and the associated eighth nerve is the receiver.

在传输过程中，不幸的是，某些东西被添加到信号中，而这些东西并不是信息源想要的。这些不必要的添加可能是声音失真（例如在电话中）或静电失真（在无线电中），或图像形状或阴影失真（电视），或传输错误（电报或传真）等。传输信号中的所有这些变化称为噪声。

In the process of being transmitted, it is unfortunately characteristic that certain things are added to the signal which were not intended by the information source. These unwanted additions may be distortions of sound (in telephony, for example) or static (in radio), or distortions in shape or shading of picture (television), or errors in transmission (telegraphy or facsimile), etc. All of these changes in the transmitted signal are called noise.

关于这种通信系统，人们想要问的问题如下：

The kind of questions which one seeks to ask concerning such a communication system are:

a. 如何衡量信息量？

a. How does one measure amount of information?

b. 如何测量通信信道的容量？

b. How does one measure the capacity of a communication channel?

c. 发射机将信息转换为信号的过程通常涉及编码过程。高效编码过程的特点是什么？当编码尽可能高效时，信道可以以什么速率传送信息？

c. The action of the transmitter in changing the message into the signal often involves a coding process. What are the characteristics of an efficient coding process? And when the coding is as efficient as possible, at what rate can the channel convey information?

d.噪声的一般特征是什么？噪声如何影响目的地最终收到的消息的准确性？如何才能最大限度地减少噪声的不良影响，以及在多大程度上可以消除噪声？

d. What are the general characteristics of noise? How does noise affect the accuracy of the message finally received at the destination? How can one minimize the undesirable effects of noise, and to what extent can they be eliminated?

e. 如果传输的信号是连续的（如口头语音或音乐），而不是由离散符号组成（如书面语音、电报等），这一事实对问题有何影响？

e. If the signal being transmitted is continuous (as in oral speech or music) rather than being formed of discrete symbols (as in written speech, telegraphy, etc.), how does this fact affect the problem?

现在我们将不使用任何证明并且只使用最少的数学术语来陈述香农获得的主要成果。

We will now state, without any proofs and with a minimum of mathematical terminology, the main results which Shannon has obtained.

2.2. 信息

2.2. Information

在本理论中，信息一词具有特殊含义，切勿与通常用法混淆。尤其是，信息不能与意义混淆。

The word information, in this theory, is used in a special sense that must not be confused with its ordinary usage. In particular, information must not be confused with meaning.

事实上，从目前的观点来看，两条信息，一条信息含义丰富，另一条信息完全是胡言乱语，在信息方面可以完全等同。毫无疑问，这就是香农所说的“通信的语义方面与工程方面无关”的意思。但这并不意味着工程方面一定与语义方面无关。

In fact, two messages, one of which is heavily loaded with meaning and the other of which is pure nonsense, can be exactly equivalent, from the present viewpoint, as regards information. It is this, undoubtedly, that Shannon means when he says that “the semantic aspects of communication are irrelevant to the engineering aspects.” But this does not mean that the engineering aspects are necessarily irrelevant to the semantic aspects.

可以肯定的是，在传播理论中，“信息”一词与你所说的话关系不大，而是与你能说什么有关。也就是说，信息是衡量一个人在选择信息时自由选择程度的标准。如果一个人面临一个非常基本的情况，他必须在两个备选信息中选择一个，那么就可以武断地说，与这种情况相关的信息是统一的。请注意，说一个或另一个信息传达单位信息是一种误导（尽管通常很方便）。信息的概念不适用于单个信息（意义的概念则如此），而是适用于整个情况，单位信息表示在这种情况下，一个人在选择信息时有一定程度的选择自由，将其视为标准或单位量很方便。

To be sure, this word information in communication theory relates not so much to what you do say, as to what you could say. That is, information is a measure of one's freedom of choice when one selects a message. If one is confronted with a very elementary situation where he has to choose one of two alternative messages, then it is arbitrarily said that the information, associated with this situation, is unity. Note that it is misleading (although often convenient) to say that one or the other message conveys unit information. The concept of information applies not to the individual messages (as the concept of meaning would), but rather to the situation as a whole, the unit information indicating that in this situation one has an amount of freedom of choice, in selecting a message, which it is convenient to regard as a standard or unit amount.

在这种选择中，人们必须从两条信息中选择一个，而这条信息可以是任何人们喜欢的内容。一条可能是《圣经》的钦定版文本，另一条可能是“是”。发送器可能会对这两条信息进行编码，使“零”成为第一条信息的信号，“一”成为第二条信息的信号；或者使闭合电路（电流流动）成为第一条信息的信号，而开路（无电流流动）成为第二条信息的信号。因此，简单继电器的两个位置（闭合和打开）可能对应于这两条信息。

The two messages between which one must choose, in such a selection, can be anything one likes. One might be the text of the King James Version of the Bible, and the other might be “Yes.” The transmitter might code these two messages so that “zero” is the signal for the first, and “one” the signal for the second; or so that a closed circuit (current flowing) is the signal for the first, and an open circuit (no current flowing) the signal for the second. Thus the two positions, closed and open, of a simple relay, might correspond to the two messages.

更明确一点，在最简单的情况下，信息量被定义为可用选择数量的对数。使用以 2 为底的3 的对数而不是以 10 为底的普通对数或布里格斯对数很方便，当只有两个选择时，信息量与以 2 为底的 2 的对数成正比。但这是单位；因此，正如上面已经提到的，两种选择的情况的特点是信息量为单位。这个信息单位称为“位”，这个词最早由 John W. Tukey 提出，是“二进制数字”的缩写。当数字以二进制表示时，只有两位数，即 0 和 1；就像在以 10 为底的十进制数系统中使用十位数字，包括 0 到 9。如上所述，零和一可以象征性地表示任何两个选择；因此“二进制数字”或者“位”就很自然的与含有单位信息的二选一的情况联系起来。

To be somewhat more definite, the amount of information is defined, in the simplest cases, to be measured by the logarithm of the number of available choices. It being convenient to use logarithms3 to the base 2, rather than common or Briggs’ logarithm to the base 10, the information, when there are only two choices, is proportional to the logarithm of 2 to the base 2. But this is unity; so that a two-choice situation is characterized by information of unity, as has already been stated above. This unit of information is called a “bit,” this word, first suggested by John W. Tukey, being a condensation of “binary digit.” When numbers are expressed in the binary system there are only two digits, namely 0 and 1; just as ten digits, 0 to 9 inclusive, are used in the decimal number system which employs 10 as a base. Zero and one may be taken symbolically to represent any two choices, as noted above; so that “binary digit” or “bit” is natural to associate with the two-choice situation which has unit information.

假设有 16 条备选消息，其中他同样可以自由选择，那么由于 16 = 2 4，从而 log 2 16 = 4 ，我们可以说这种情况的特征是 4 位信息。

If one has available say 16 alternative messages among which he is equally free to choose, then since 16 = 24 so that log2 16 = 4, one says that this situation is characterized by 4 bits of information.

毫无疑问，当人们第一次接触到信息时，人们会觉得很奇怪，信息被定义为选择数量的对数。但随着理论的展开，对数度量实际上是自然度量，这一点变得越来越明显。目前，对此只有一个迹象。上面提到，一个简单的开或关继电器，其两个位置分别标记为 0 和 1，可以处理单位信息情况，其中只有两个消息选择。如果一个继电器可以处理单位信息，那么三个继电器可以处理多少信息？说三个继电器可以处理的信息量是一个继电器的三倍似乎是非常合理的。如果使用信息的对数定义，结果确实如此。因为三个继电器能够响应 2 3或 8 个选择，这些选择可以用符号表示为 000、001、011、010、100、110、101、111，在第一个选择中，所有三个继电器都打开，在最后一个选择中，所有三个继电器都关闭。​​2 3以 2 为底的对数是 3，因此对数测量为这种情况分配了三个信息单位，正如人们所希望的那样。同样，将可用时间加倍会使可能的消息数量平方，并使对数加倍；因此，如果以对数方式测量，信息量也会加倍。

It doubtless seems queer, when one first meets it, that information is defined as the logarithm of the number of choices. But in the unfolding of the theory, it becomes more and more obvious that logarithmic measures are in fact the natural ones. At the moment, only one indication of this will be given. It was mentioned above that one simple on-or-off relay, with its two positions labeled, say, 0 and 1 respectively, can handle a unit information situation, in which there are but two message choices. If one relay can handle unit information, how much can be handled by say three relays? It seems very reasonable to want to say that three relays could handle three times as much information as one. And this indeed is the way it works out if one uses the logarithmic definition of information. For three relays are capable of responding to 23 or 8 choices, which symbolically might be written as 000, 001, 011, 010, 100, 110, 101, 111, in the first of which all three relays are open, and in the last of which all three relays are closed. And the logarithm to the base 2 of 23 is 3, so that the logarithmic measure assigns three units of information to this situation, just as one would wish. Similarly, doubling the available time squares the number of possible messages, and doubles the logarithm; and hence doubles the information if it is measured logarithmically.

到目前为止，这些评论都涉及人为的简单情况，即信息源只能在几条确定的消息之间自由选择——就像一个人从一组标准的生日祝福电报中挑选一条一样。更自然、更重要的情况是，信息源从一组基本符号中做出一系列选择，所选的序列然后形成消息。因此，一个人可以挑选一个又一个的单词，然后这些单独选择的单词加在一起形成消息。

The remarks thus far relate to artificially simple situations where the information source is free to choose only between several definite messages—like a man picking out one of a set of standard birthday greeting telegrams. A more natural and more important situation is that in which the information source makes a sequence of choices from some set of elementary symbols, the selected sequence then forming the message. Thus a man may pick out one word after another, these individually selected words then adding up to form the message.

此时，一个重要的考虑因素被提了出来，而这个因素到目前为止一直处于幕后，现在引起了人们的极大关注。即概率在消息生成中所起的作用。因为在选择连续符号时，这些选择至少从通信系统的角度来看，受概率支配；事实上，受概率支配，这些概率并非独立，而是在过程的任何阶段都取决于先前的选择。因此，如果我们关注的是英语语音，并且如果最后选择的符号是“the”，那么下一个单词是冠词或动词形式而不是动词形式的概率就非常小。事实上，这种概率影响延伸到两个以上的单词。在三个单词“in the event”之后，“that”作为下一个单词的概率相当高，而“elephant”作为下一个单词的概率非常低。

At this point an important consideration which has been in the background, so far, comes to the front for major attention. Namely, the role which probability plays in the generation of the message. For as the successive symbols are chosen, these choices are, at least from the point of view of the communication system, governed by probabilities; and in fact by probabilities which are not independent, but which, at any stage of the process, depend upon the preceding choices. Thus, if we are concerned with English speech, and if the last symbol chosen is “the,” then the probability that the next word be an article, or a verb form other than a verbal, is very small. This probabilistic influence stretches over more than two words, in fact. After the three words “in the event” the probability for “that” as the next word is fairly high, and for “elephant” as the next word is very low.

例如，如果我们想到这样一个事实，即在我们的语言中，字典中根本不包含首字母 j 后面跟着 b、c、d、f、g、j、k、l、q、r、t、v、w、x 或 z 的单词，那么显然存在着对英语产生一定程度控制的概率；因此，首字母 j 后面跟着这些字母中的任何一个的概率实际上为零。同样，任何人都会同意，像“Constantinople fishing nasty pink”这样的单词序列的概率很低。顺便说一句，这个概率很低，但不是零；因为完全有可能想到一个段落，其中一个句子以“Constantinople fishing”结尾，而下一个句子以“Nasty pink”开头。我们可能会顺便注意到，我们讨论的这个不太可能的四词序列出现在一个好的英语句子中，即上面的句子。

That there are probabilities which exert a certain degree of control over the English language also becomes obvious if one thinks, for example, of the fact that in our language the dictionary contains no words whatsoever in which the initial letter j is followed by b, c, d, f, g, j, k, l, q, r, t, v, w, x, or z; so that the probability is actually zero that an initial j be followed by any of these letters. Similarly, anyone would agree that the probability is low for such a sequence of words as “Constantinople fishing nasty pink.” Incidentally, it is low, but not zero; for it is perfectly possible to think of a passage in which one sentence closes with “Constantinople fishing,” and the next begins with “Nasty pink.” And we might observe in passing that the unlikely four-word sequence under discussion has occurred in a single good English sentence, namely the one above.

根据一定概率产生符号序列（当然，这些符号序列可能是字母或音符，而不是单词）的系统称为随机过程，随机过程的特殊情况是概率取决于先前事件，称为马尔可夫过程或马尔可夫链。在可能产生消息的马尔可夫过程中，有一类对通信理论至关重要，即所谓的遍历过程。这里的分析细节非常复杂，推理也非常深刻和复杂，以至于一些最优秀的数学家付出了最大的努力才创造出相关理论；但遍历过程的大致性质很容易理解。它产生的符号序列是民意测验者的梦想，因为任何相当大的样本往往代表整个序列。假设两个人以不同的方式选择样本方式，并研究随着样本的增大，它们的统计特性会呈现什么样的趋势。如果情况是遍历的，那么这两个人，无论他们如何选择样本，对整体特性的估计都是一致的。换句话说，遍历系统表现出一种特别安全和令人欣慰的统计规律。

A system which produces a sequence of symbols (which may, of course, be letters or musical notes, say, rather than words) according to certain probabilities is called a stochastic process, and the special case of a stochastic process in which the probabilities depend on the previous events, is called a Mark off process or a Markoff chain. Of the Markoff processes which might conceivably generate messages, there is a special class which is of primary importance for communication theory, these being what are called ergodic processes. The analytical details here are complicated and the reasoning so deep and involved that it has taken some of the best efforts of the best mathematicians to create the associated theory; but the rough nature of an ergodic process is easy to understand. It is one which produces a sequence of symbols which would be a poll-taker's dream, because any reasonably large sample tends to be representative of the sequence as a whole. Suppose that two persons choose samples in different ways, and study what trends their statistical properties would show as the samples become larger. If the situation is ergodic, then those two persons, however they may have chosen their samples, agree in their estimates of the properties of the whole. Ergodic systems, in other words, exhibit a particularly safe and comforting sort of statistical regularity.

现在让我们回到信息的概念。当我们有一个信息源，它通过连续选择离散符号（字母、单词、音符、一定大小的点等）来产生消息时，在过程的某一阶段，选择各种符号的概率取决于先前的选择（即马尔科夫过程），那么与此过程相关的信息又如何呢？

Now let us return to the idea of information. When we have an information source which is producing a message by successively selecting discrete symbols (letters, words, musical notes, spots of a certain size, etc.), the probability of choice of the various symbols at one stage of the process being dependent on the previous choices (i.e., a Markoff process), what about the information associated with this procedure?

唯一满足人们为“信息”设定的自然要求的量，原来就是热力学中所谓的熵。它用各种概率来表示——在形成信息的过程中到达某些阶段的概率，以及在这些阶段中，某些符号被选中的概率。此外，该公式涉及概率的对数，因此它是上面与简单情况相关的对数度量的自然概括。

The quantity which uniquely meets the natural requirements that one sets up for “information” turns out to be exactly that which is known in thermodynamics as entropy. It is expressed in terms of the various probabilities involved—those of getting to certain stages in the process of forming messages, and the probabilities that, when in those stages, certain symbols be chosen next. The formula, moreover, involves the logarithm of probabilities, so that it is a natural generalization of the logarithmic measure spoken of above in connection with simple cases.

对于研究过物理科学的人来说，最重要的是，熵的表达式出现在理论中作为信息的量度。熵是克劳修斯在近一百年前提出的，与玻尔兹曼的名字密切相关，吉布斯在其经典的统计力学著作中赋予了深刻的含义，熵已经成为如此基本和普遍的概念，以至于爱丁顿评论说：“我认为，熵总是增加的定律——热力学第二定律——在自然定律中占据着至高无上的地位。”

To those who have studied the physical sciences, it is most significant that an entropy-like expression appears in the theory as a measure of information. Introduced by Clausius nearly one hundred years ago, closely associated with the name of Boltzmann, and given deep meaning by Gibbs in his classic work on statistical mechanics, entropy has become so basic and pervasive a concept that Eddington remarks “The law that entropy always increases—the second law of thermodynamics—holds, I think, the supreme position among the laws of Nature.”

在物理学中，与某种情况相关的熵是衡量该情况随机性或“混乱程度”的指标；物理系统变得越来越无组织、越来越混乱的趋势是如此基本，以至于爱丁顿认为，主要是这种趋势赋予了时间之箭——例如，它可以向我们揭示物理世界的电影是向前播放还是向后播放。

In the physical sciences, the entropy associated with a situation is a measure of the degree of randomness, or of “shuffledness” if you will, in the situation; and the tendency of physical systems to become less and less organized, to become more and more perfectly shuffled, is so basic that Eddington argues that it is primarily this tendency which gives time its arrow—which would reveal to us, for example, whether a movie of the physical world is being run forward or backward.

因此，当人们在通信理论中遇到熵的概念时，他们有权感到兴奋——有权怀疑自己掌握了某些可能变得基本而重要的东西。毕竟，当我们记住，在通信理论中，信息与我们在构建消息时拥有的选择自由量有关时，用熵来衡量信息是很自然的。因此，对于通信源，人们可以说，就像他谈论热力学集合一样，“这种情况是高度组织化的，它不具有很大的随机性或选择程度——也就是说，信息（或熵）很低。”我们稍后会回到这一点，因为除非我完全弄错了，否则这是该理论更普遍意义的一个重要方面。

Thus when one meets the concept of entropy in communication theory, he has a right to be rather excited—a right to suspect that one has hold of something that may turn out to be basic and important. That information be measured by entropy is, after all, natural when we remember that information, in communication theory, is associated with the amount of freedom of choice we have in constructing messages. Thus for a communication source one can say, just as he would also say it of a thermodynamic ensemble, “This situation is highly organized, it is not characterized by a large degree of randomness or of choice—that is to say, the information (or the entropy) is low.” We will return to this point later, for unless I am quite mistaken, it is an important aspect of the more general significance of this theory.

计算出某个信息源的熵（或信息，或选择自由）后，可以将其与该熵可能具有的最大值进行比较，但前提是该信息源继续使用相同的符号。实际熵与最大熵之比称为该源的相对熵。如果某个源的相对熵为 0.8，这粗略意味着该源在选择符号形成消息时，大约有 80% 的自由度可以使用相同的符号。一减去相对熵称为冗余度。这是消息结构的一部分，它不是由发送者的自由选择决定的，而是由管理相关符号使用的公认统计规则决定的。它被合理地称为冗余度，因为消息的这部分实际上在接近通常意义上是冗余的；也就是说，这部分信息是不必要的（因此是重复或多余的），即使这部分信息缺失，信息仍然基本上是完整的，或者至少可以完成。

Having calculated the entropy (or the information, or the freedom of choice) of a certain information source, one can compare this to the maximum value this entropy could have, subject only to the condition that the source continue to employ the same symbols. The ratio of the actual to the maximum entropy is called the relative entropy of the source. If the relative entropy of a certain source is, say .8, this roughly means that this source is, in its choice of symbols to form a message, about 80 per cent as free as it could possibly be with these same symbols. One minus the relative entropy is called the redundancy. This is the fraction of the structure of the message which is determined not by the free choice of the sender, but rather by the accepted statistical rules governing the use of the symbols in question. It is sensibly called redundancy, for this fraction of the message is in fact redundant in something close to the ordinary sense; that is to say, this fraction of the message is unnecessary (and hence repetitive or redundant) in the sense that if it were missing the message would still be essentially complete, or at least could be completed.

最有趣的是，英语的冗余度刚好达到 50% 4 ，因此，我们在书写或口语中选择的字母或单词中，大约有一半是我们自由选择的，而大约有一半（尽管我们通常没有意识到）实际上是由语言的统计结构控制的。除了更严重的含义（我们将再次将其推迟到最后的讨论）之外，值得注意的是，如果要构造令人满意的填字游戏，一种语言在字母选择方面必须具有至少 50% 的真正自由度（或相对熵）。如果它拥有完全的自由度，那么每个字母阵列都是一个填字游戏。如果它只有 20% 的自由度，那么就不可能构造出如此复杂和数量的填字游戏，使游戏流行起来。香农估计，如果英语只有大约 30% 的冗余度，那么就有可能构造三维填字游戏。

It is most interesting to note that the redundancy of English is just about 50 per cent,4 so that about half of the letters or words we choose in writing or speaking are under our free choice, and about half (although we are not ordinarily aware of it) are really controlled by the statistical structure of the language. Apart from more serious implications, which again we will postpone to our final discussion, it is interesting to note that a language must have at least 50 per cent of real freedom (or relative entropy) in the choice of letters if one is to be able to construct satisfactory crossword puzzles. If it has complete freedom, then every array of letters is a crossword puzzle. If it has only 20 per cent of freedom, then it would be impossible to construct crossword puzzles in such complexity and number as would make the game popular. Shannon has estimated that if the English language had only about 30 per cent redundancy, then it would be possible to construct three-dimensional crossword puzzles.

在结束关于信息的这一节之前，应该指出，A 级分析处理的信息概念描述了信息源的整个统计性质，而不涉及单个消息（也不直接涉及单个消息的含义），其真正原因是从工程的角度来看，通信系统必须面对处理源可以产生的任何消息的问题。如果设计一个可以完美处理所有事情的系统是不可能的或不切实际的，那么系统应该被设计成能够很好地处理最有可能被要求完成的工作，并且应该接受在罕见任务上效率较低。这种考虑立即导致有必要描述给定类型的源可以和将要产生的整个消息集合的统计性质。而通信理论中使用的信息正是这样做的。

Before closing this section on information, it should be noted that the real reason that Level A analysis deals with a concept of information which characterizes the whole statistical nature of the information source, and is not concerned with the individual messages (and not at all directly concerned with the meaning of the individual messages) is that from the point of view of engineering, a communication system must face the problem of handling any message that the source can produce. If it is not possible or practicable to design a system which can handle everything perfectly, then the system should be designed to handle well the jobs it is most likely to be asked to do, and should resign itself to be less efficient for the rare task. This sort of consideration leads at once to the necessity of characterizing the statistical nature of the whole ensemble of messages which a given kind of source can and will produce. And information, as used in communication theory, does just this.

虽然本文的目的根本不是讨论数学细节，但尽可能理解衡量信息的熵类表达式似乎是必不可少的。如果我们关注的是一组n 个独立符号，或者一组 n 个独立的完整消息，就像在一个简单的例子中一样，它们的选择概率为p 1、p 2 ... p n，那么信息的实际表达式就是

Although it is not at all the purpose of this paper to be concerned with mathematical details, it nevertheless seems essential to have as good an understanding as possible of the entropy-like expression which measures information. If one is concerned, as in a simple case, with a set of n independent symbols, or a set of n independent complete messages for that matter, whose probabilities of choice are p1, p2…pn, then the actual expression for the information is

H = — [ p 1 log p 1 + p 2 log p 2 +…+ p n log p n ]，

H = — [p1 log p1 + p2 log p2+…+pn log pn],

或者

or

H = — ∑pilogpi 。​​​

H = — Σ pi log pi.

其中5符号 ∑ 表示（在数学中通常如此），将所有项相加，例如典型的p i log p i，写为定义样本。

Where5 the symbol ∑ indicates, as is usual in mathematics, that one is to sum all terms like the typical one, pi log pi, written as a defining sample.

这看起来有点复杂；但让我们看看这个表达式在一些简单情况下如何表现。

This looks a little complicated; but let us see how this expression behaves in some simple cases.

首先假设我们仅在两条可能的消息之间进行选择，那么第一条消息的概率为p 1 ，另一条消息的概率为p 2 = 1 — p 1。在这种情况下，如果估算H的数值，则当两条消息的概率相等时，即当p 1 = p 2 =时，即当人们完全可以自由地在两条消息之间进行选择时， H具有最大值，即 1。只要一条消息的概率大于另一条消息的概率（例如， p 1大于p 2 ）， H的值就会减小。而当一条消息的概率非常大时（例如， p 1几乎为 1 而p 2几乎为 0）， H的值就会非常小（几乎为 0）。

Suppose first that we are choosing only between two possible messages, whose probabilities are then p1 for the first and p2 = 1 — p1 for the other. If one reckons, for this case, the numerical value of H, it turns out that H has its largest value, namely one, when the two messages are equally probable; that is to say when p1 = p2 = ; that is to say, when one is completely free to choose between the two messages. Just as soon as one message becomes more probable than the other (p1 greater than p2, say), the value of H decreases. And when one message is very probable (p1 almost one and p2 almost zero, say), the value of H is very small (almost zero).

在极限情况下，一个概率为 1（确定性），而其他概率都为 0（不可能），那么H就是零（完全没有不确定性 — — 没有选择自由 — — 没有信息）。

In the limiting case where one probability is unity (certainty) and all the others zero (impossibility), then H is zero (no uncertainty at all—no freedom of choice—no information).

因此，当两个概率相等时（即，当一个人在选择上完全自由和无偏见时），H最大，而当一个人的选择自由消失时，H 减小到零。

Thus H is largest when the two probabilities are equal (i.e., when one is completely free and unbiased in the choice), and reduces to zero when one's freedom of choice is gone.

刚才描述的情况实际上很典型。如果有很多选择，而不是两个，那么当各种选择的概率在情况允许的范围内尽可能接近相等时， H最大——当人们在做选择时有尽可能多的自由，尽可能少地被某些概率超过其份额的选择所驱使。另一方面，假设一个选择的概率接近 1，而所有其他选择的概率都接近于 0。这显然是一种人们严重倾向于某一特定选择的情况，因此几乎没有选择自由。在这种情况下，H确实会计算出一个非常小的值——信息（选择自由、不确定性）很低。

The situation just described is in fact typical. If there are many, rather than two, choices, then H is largest when the probabilities of the various choices are as nearly equal as circumstances permit—when one has as much freedom as possible in making a choice, being as little as possible driven toward some certain choices which have more than their share of probability. Suppose, on the other hand, that one choice has a probability near one so that all the other choices have probabilities near zero. This is clearly a situation in which one is heavily influenced toward one particular choice, and hence has little freedom of choice. And H in such a case does calculate to have a very small value—the information (the freedom of choice, the uncertainty) is low.

当案例数量固定时，我们刚刚看到信息量越大，各种情况的概率就越接近相等。增加H的另一种重要方法是增加情况的数量。更准确地说，如果所有选择的概率都相等，那么选择越多，H就越大。如果你从一组 50 条标准消息中自由选择，那么比从一组 25 条消息中自由选择，那么“信息”就更多。

When the number of cases is fixed, we have just seen that then the information is the greater, the more nearly equal are the probabilities of the various cases. There is another important way of increasing H, namely by increasing the number of cases. More accurately, if all choices are equally likely, the more choices there are, the larger H will be. There is more “information” if you select freely out of a set of fifty standard messages, than if you select freely out of a set of twenty-five.

2.3. 通信信道的容量

2.3. Capacity of a Communication Channel

经过上一节的讨论，人们不会对信道容量不是用它能传输的符号数量来描述，而是用它传输的信息来描述这一点感到惊讶。或者更确切地说，由于最后一个短语特别容易误解“信息”这个词，信道容量应该用它传输给定信息源产生的内容的能力来描述。

After the discussion of the preceding section, one is not surprised that the capacity of a channel is to be described not in terms of the number of symbols it can transmit, but rather in terms of the information it transmits. Or better, since this last phrase lends itself particularly well to a misinterpretation of the word information, the capacity of a channel is to be described in terms of its ability to transmit what is produced out of source of a given information.

如果源是简单类型，其中所有符号的时间持续时间都相同（例如，电传打字机就是这种情况），如果源的每个选定符号代表s比特信息（从 2 s 个符号中自由选择），并且如果信道每秒可以传输n 个符号，则信道的容量C定义为每秒ns比特。

If the source is of a simple sort in which all symbols are of the same time duration (which is the case, for example, with teletype), if the source is such that each symbol chosen represents s bits of information (being freely chosen from among 2s symbols), and if the channel can transmit, say n symbols per second, then the capacity of C of the channel is defined to be ns bits per second.

在更一般的情况下，必须考虑各种符号的不同长度。因此，信道容量的一般表达式涉及特定时间持续时间的符号数量的对数（当然，这引入了信息的概念，并对应于上一段简单情况下的因子 s）；还涉及处理的此类符号的数量（对应于上一段中的因子n）。因此，在一般情况下，容量不是衡量每秒传输的符号数量，而是衡量每秒传输的信息量，以比特/秒为单位。

In a more general case, one has to take account of the varying lengths of the various symbols. Thus the general expression for capacity of a channel involves the logarithm of the numbers of symbols of certain time duration (which introduces, of course, the idea of information and corresponds to the factor s in the simple case of the preceding paragraph); and also involves the number of such symbols handled (which corresponds to the factor n of the preceding paragraph). Thus in the general case, capacity measures not the number of symbols transmitted per second, but rather the amount of information transmitted per second, using bits per second as its unit.

2.4. 编码

2.4. Coding

一开始就指出，发送器接受信息并将其转换成所谓的信号，后者实际上是通过信道传递到接收器的东西。

At the outset it was pointed out that the transmitter accepts the message and turns it into something called the signal, the latter being what actually passes over the channel to the receiver.

在电话等情况下，发送器只是将可听见的语音信号转换为某种东西（电话线上变化的电流），这种东西既明显不同，又明显相同。但发送器可以对消息执行更复杂的操作来产生信号。例如，它可以获取书面消息并使用某种代码将该消息加密为数字序列；然后这些数字作为信号通过信道发送。

The transmitter, in such a case as telephony, merely changes the audible voice signal over into something (the varying electrical current on the telephone wire) which is at once clearly different but clearly equivalent. But the transmitter may carry out a much more complex operation on the message to produce the signal. It could, for example, take a written message and use some code to encipher this message into, say a sequence of numbers; these numbers then being sent over the channel as the signal.

因此，一般来说，发送器的功能是编码信息，而接收器的功能是解码信息。该理论提供了非常复杂的发送器和接收器——例如，它们拥有“记忆”，因此它们对信息中某个符号的编码方式不仅取决于这个符号，还取决于信息中以前的符号及其编码方式。

Thus one says, in general, that the function of the transmitter is to encode, and that of the receiver to decode, the message. The theory provides for very sophisticated transmitters and receivers—such, for example, as possess “memories,” so that the way they encode a certain symbol of the message depends not only upon this one symbol, but also upon previous symbols of the message and the way they have been encoded.

现在，我们可以陈述该理论中提出的用于传输离散符号的无噪声信道的基本定理。该定理涉及每秒容量为C比特的通信信道，该信道从每符号H比特的熵（或信息）源接收信号。该定理指出，通过为发射机设计适当的编码程序，可以以平均速率6通过信道传输符号，该速率接近C/H，但无论编码多么巧妙，都不可能超过C/H。

We are now in a position to state the fundamental theorem, produced in this theory, for a noiseless channel transmitting discrete symbols. This theorem relates to a communication channel which has a capacity of C bits per second, accepting signals from a source of entropy (or information) of H bits per symbol. The theorem states that by devising proper coding procedures for the transmitter it is possible to transmit symbols over the channel at an average rate6 which is nearly C/H, but which, no matter how clever the coding, can never be made to exceed C/H.

稍后我们将讨论这个定理的意义，届时我们将讨论噪声存在的更一般情况。不过目前，重要的是要注意编码所起的关键作用。

The significance of this theorem is to be discussed more usefully a little later, when we have the more general case when noise is present. For the moment, though, it is important to notice the critical role which coding plays.

请记住，与生成消息或信号的过程相关的熵（或信息）由过程的统计特征决定——由到达消息情况和在这些情况下选择下一个符号的各种概率决定。消息的统计性质完全由源的特征决定。但信道实际传输的信号的统计特性，以及信道中的熵，既取决于试图输入信道的内容，也取决于信道处理不同信号情况的能力。例如，在电报中，点与点之间、点与划之间以及划与划之间必须有空格，否则点与划将无法识别。

Remember that the entropy (or information) associated with the process which generates messages or signals is determined by the statistical character of the process—by the various probabilities for arriving at message situations and for choosing, when in those situations the next symbols. The statistical nature of messages is entirely determined by the character of the source. But the statistical character of the signal as actually transmitted by a channel, and hence the entropy in the channel, is determined both by what one attempts to feed into the channel and by the capabilities of the channel to handle different signal situations. For example, in telegraphy, there have to be spaces between dots and dots, between dots and dashes, and between dashes and dashes, or the dots and dashes would not be recognizable.

现在事实证明，当信道确实具有某些此类约束，从而限制了信号的完全自由时，某些统计信号特性会导致信号熵大于任何其他统计信号结构的熵，并且在这种重要情况下，信号熵恰好等于信道容量。

Now it turns out that when a channel does have certain constraints of this sort, which limit complete signal freedom, there are certain statistical signal characteristics which lead to a signal entropy which is larger than it would be for any other statistical signal structure, and in this important case, the signal entropy is exactly equal to the channel capacity.

按照这些思想，现在可以精确地描述最有效的编码类型，事实上，最好的发送器是对信息进行编码的方式，使得信号具有最适合所用信道的最佳统计特性——这实际上最大化了信号（或者可以说是信道）的熵并使其等于信道的容量C。

In terms of these ideas, it is now possible precisely to characterize the most efficient kind of coding, The best transmitter, in fact, is that which codes the message in such a way that the signal has just those optimum statistical characteristics which are best suited to the channel to be used—which in fact maximize the signal (or one may say, the channel) entropy and make it equal to the capacity C of the channel.

根据上述基本定理，这种编码方式可实现符号传输的最大速率C/H 。但为了提高传输速率，人们需要付出代价。因为相当奇怪的是，随着编码越来越接近理想状态，人们不得不在编码过程中承受越来越长的延迟。这种困境的部分原因是，在电子设备中，“长”可能意味着极小的几分之一秒，另一部分原因是人们需要做出妥协，在传输速率的提高与编码时间的损失之间取得平衡。

This kind of coding leads, by the fundamental theorem above, to the maximum rate C/H for the transmission of symbols. But for this gain in transmission rate, one pays a price. For rather perversely it happens that as one makes the coding more and more nearly ideal, one is forced to longer and longer delays in the process of coding. Part of this dilemma is met by the fact that in electronic equipment “long” may mean an exceedingly small fraction of a second, and part by the fact that one makes a compromise, balancing the gain in transmission rate against loss of coding time.

2.5. 噪音

2.5. Noise

噪音如何影响信息？我们必须牢牢记住，信息是衡量一个人选择信息自由度的标准。这种选择自由度越大，信息量也就越大，实际选择的信息是否是某个特定信息的不确定性就越大。因此，信息量越大选择自由、更大的不确定性、更多的信息齐头并进。

How does noise affect information? Information is, we must steadily remember, a measure of one's freedom of choice in selecting a message. The greater this freedom of choice, and hence the greater the information, the greater is the uncertainty that the message actually selected is some particular one. Thus greater freedom of choice, greater uncertainty, greater information go hand in hand.

如果引入了噪音，那么收到的信息就会包含某些扭曲、某些错误、某些无关内容，这肯定会让人说，由于噪音的影响，收到的信息表现出不确定性增加。但如果不确定性增加，信息就会增加，这听起来好像噪音是有益的！

If noise is introduced, then the received message contains certain distortions, certain errors, certain extraneous material, that would certainly lead one to say that the received message exhibits, because of the effects of the noise, an increased uncertainty. But if the uncertainty is increased, the information is increased, and this sounds as though the noise were beneficial!

一般情况下，当有噪声时，接收信号会显示更多信息，或者更确切地说，接收信号是从比发送信号更加多样化的集合中选择出来的。这种情况很好地说明了人们可能陷入的语义陷阱，如果他不记得“信息”在这里具有特殊含义，即衡量选择的自由度，因此衡量了做出何种选择的不确定性。因此，信息这个词可能有好的或坏的含义。由于发送方的选择自由而产生的不确定性是可取的不确定性。由于错误或噪声影响而产生的不确定性是不受欢迎的不确定性。

It is generally true that when there is noise, the received signal exhibits greater information—or better, the received signal is selected out of a more varied set than is the transmitted signal. This is a situation which beautifully illustrates the semantic trap into which one can fall if he does not remember that “information” is used here with a special meaning that measures freedom of choice and hence uncertainty as to what choice has been made. It is therefore possible for the word information to have either good or bad connotations. Uncertainty which arises by virtue of freedom of choice on the part of the sender is desirable uncertainty. Uncertainty which arises because of errors or because of the influence of noise is undesirable uncertainty.

因此，很明显，有人说接收信号包含更多信息。其中一些信息是虚假的、不需要的，是通过噪声引入的。为了在接收信号中获得有用的信息，我们必须减去这个虚假部分。

It is thus clear where the joker is in saying that the received signal has more information. Some of this information is spurious and undesirable and has been introduced via the noise. To get the useful information in the received signal we must subtract out this spurious portion.

在弄清楚这一点之前，我们必须稍微绕个弯子。假设有两组符号，例如信息源生成的消息符号和实际接收到的信号符号。这两组符号的概率是相互关联的，因为接收某个符号的概率显然取决于发送的符号。如果没有噪声或其他原因的错误，接收到的信号将与发送的消息符号完全对应；如果存在可能的错误，接收到的符号的概率显然会严重依赖于与发送的消息符号对应或接近对应的符号。

Before we can clear up this point we have to stop for a little detour. Suppose one has two sets of symbols, such as the message symbols generated by the information source, and the signal symbols which are actually received. The probabilities of these two sets of symbols are interrelated, for clearly the probability of receiving a certain symbol depends upon what symbol was sent. With no errors from noise or from other causes, the received signals would correspond precisely to the message symbols sent; and in the presence of possible error, the probabilities for received symbols would obviously be loaded heavily on those which correspond, or closely correspond, to the message symbols sent.

现在，在这种情况下，我们可以计算一组符号相对于另一组符号的熵。例如，让我们考虑消息相对于信号。遗憾的是，如果不进行详细研究，我们就无法理解这里涉及的问题。假设我们暂时知道某个信号符号确实已被接收。那么每个消息符号都具有一定的概率——对于与接收符号相同或相似的符号，概率相对较大，而对于所有其他符号，概率相对较小。利用这组概率，可以计算出一个暂定的熵值。这是在假设有明确的已知接收符号或信号符号的情况下的消息熵。在任何良好条件下，它的值都很低，因为所涉及的概率在各种情况下并不是均匀分布的，而是在一种或几种情况下负载较大。在完全没有噪声的任何情况下，它的值都将为零（见第 13 页），因为这样，信号符号已知，除了一个符号（即接收符号）具有 1 的概率外，所有消息概率都将为零。

Now in such a situation one can calculate what is called the entropy of one set of symbols relative to the other. Let us, for example, consider the entropy of the message relative to the signal. It is unfortunate that we cannot understand the issues involved here without going into some detail. Suppose for the moment that one knows that a certain signal symbol has actually been received. Then each message symbol takes on a certain probability—relatively large for the symbol identical with or the symbols similar to the one received, and relatively small for all others. Using this set of probabilities, one calculates a tentative entropy value. This is the message entropy on the assumption of a definite known received or signal symbol. Under any good conditions its value is low, since the probabilities involved are not spread around rather evenly on the various cases, but are heavily loaded on one or a few cases. Its value would be zero (see page 13) in any case where noise was completely absent, for then, the signal symbol being known, all message probabilities would be zero except for one symbol (namely the one received), which would have a probability of unity.

对于接收到的信号符号的每一个假设，都可以计算出这些暂定的消息熵之一。计算所有这些熵，然后取平均值，根据计算时假设的信号符号的概率对每个熵进行加权。当有两组符号需要考虑时，以这种方式计算出的熵称为相对熵。刚刚描述的特定熵是消息相对于信号的熵，香农也将其命名为“歧义”。

For each assumption as to the signal symbol received, one can calculate one of these tentative message entropies. Calculate all of them, and then average them, weighting each one in accordance with the probability of the signal symbol assumed in calculating it. Entropies calculated in this way, when there are two sets of symbols to consider, are called relative entropies. The particular one just described is the entropy of the message relative to the signal, and Shannon has named this also the equivocation.

从计算这种不确定性的方式，我们可以看出它的重要性。它衡量的是当信号已知时，信息中的平均不确定性。如果没有噪声，那么在信号已知的情况下，信息中就不会存在不确定性。如果在信号已知之后，信息源有任何剩余不确定性，那么这一定是由于噪声而产生的不受欢迎的不确定性。

From the way this equivocation is calculated, we can see what its significance is. It measures the average uncertainty in the message when the signal is known. If there were no noise, then there would be no uncertainty concerning the message if the signal is known. If the information source has any residual uncertainty after the signal is known, then this must be undesirable uncertainty due to noise.

最后几段的讨论集中在“当接收信号已知时，消息源的平均不确定性”这个量上。它同样可以用类似的量来表达：“当发送的消息已知时，接收信号的平均不确定性”。当然，如果没有噪音，后者的不确定性也将为零。

The discussion of the last few paragraphs centers around the quantity “the average uncertainty in the message source when the received signal is known.” It can equally well be phrased in terms of the similar quantity “the average uncertainty concerning the received signal when the message sent is known.” This latter uncertainty would, of course, also be zero if there were no noise.

至于这些量的相互关系，很容易证明

As to the interrelationship of these quantities, it is easy to prove that

H ( x ) — Hy ( x ) = H ( y ) — Hx ( y )

H(x) — Hy(x) = H(y) — Hx(y)

其中H ( x ) 是消息源的熵或信息量；H ( y ) 是接收信号的熵或信息量；H y ( x ) 是歧义，即如果信号已知，则消息源的不确定性；H x ( y ) 是接收信号的不确定性，即如果发送的消息已知，则接收信号的信息中由于噪声而产生的杂散部分。等式的右边是有用的信息，即尽管受到噪声的不良影响，但仍被传输的信息。

where H(x) is the entropy or information of the source of messages; H(y) the entropy or information of received signals; Hy(x) the equivocation, or the uncertainty in the message source if the signal be known; Hx(y) the uncertainty in the received signals if the messages sent be known, or the spurious part of the received signal information which is due to noise. The right side of this equation is the useful information which is transmitted in spite of the bad effect of the noise.

现在可以解释噪声信道容量C的含义了。事实上，它的定义等于有用信息（即总不确定性减去噪声不确定性）在信道上传输的最大速率（单位为比特/秒）。

It is now possible to explain what one means by the capacity C of a noisy channel. It is, in fact, defined to be equal to the maximum rate (in bits per second) at which useful information (i.e., total uncertainty minus noise uncertainty) can be transmitted over the channel.

为什么这里要说“最大”速率？我们能做什么来使这个速率变大或变小？答案是，我们可以通过选择一个统计特性与信道性质所施加的限制适当相关的源来影响这个速率。也就是说，我们可以通过适当的编码来最大化传输有用信息的速率（见第16-17页）。

Why does one speak, here, of a “maximum” rate? What can one do, that is, to make this rate larger or smaller? The answer is that one can affect this rate by choosing a source whose statistical characteristics are suitably related to the restraints imposed by the nature of the channel. That is, one can maximize the rate of transmitting useful information by using proper coding (see pages 16-17).

现在，最后，让我们考虑一下噪声信道的基本定理。假设这个噪声信道具有刚才描述的容量C，假设它从一个熵为H ( x ) 比特每秒的信息源接收信息，而接收信号的熵为H ( y ) 比特每秒。如果信道容量C等于或大于H ( x )，那么通过设计适当的编码系统，源的输出就可以通过信道传输，并且误差尽可能小。不管你指定的误差频率有多小，总有一个代码可以满足要求。但是，如果信道容量C小于H ( x )（即它接受消息的源的熵），那么就不可能设计出将误差频率降低到尽可能低的代码。

And now, finally, let us consider the fundamental theorem for a noisy channel. Suppose that this noisy channel has, in the sense just described, a capacity C, suppose it is accepting from an information source characterized by an entropy of H(x) bits per second, the entropy of the received signals being H(y) bits per second. If the channel capacity C is equal to or larger than H(x), then by devising appropriate coding systems, the output of the source can be transmitted over the channel with as little error as one pleases. However small a frequency of error you specify, there is a code which meets the demand. But if the channel capacity C is less than H(x), the entropy of the source from which it accepts messages, then it is impossible to devise codes which reduce the error frequency as low as one may please.

无论编码过程多么巧妙，在收到信号后，总会存在一些关于信息是什么的不受欢迎的（噪音）不确定性；这种不受欢迎的不确定性——这种模棱两可——总是等于或大于H ( x ) — C。此外，总有至少一种代码能够减少这种不确定性关于消息的不良不确定性，低至超过H ( x ) — C的任意小量的值。

However clever one is with the coding process, it will always be true that after the signal is received there remains some undesirable (noise) uncertainty about what the message was; and this undesirable uncertainty—this equivocation—will always be equal to or greater than H(x) — C. Furthermore, there is always at least one code which is capable of reducing this undesirable uncertainty, concerning the message, down to a value which exceeds H(x) — C by an arbitrarily small amount.

当然，最重要的方面是，无论编码过程多么复杂或适当，最小的不良或虚假不确定性都无法进一步减少。这个强大的定理精确而又简单得令人吃惊地描述了在存在噪声的情况下，通信信道所能获得的最大可靠性。

The most important aspect, of course, is that the minimum undesirable or spurious uncertainties cannot be reduced further, no matter how complicated or appropriate the coding process. This powerful theorem gives a precise and almost startlingly simple description of the utmost dependability one can ever obtain from a communication channel which operates in the presence of noise.

应该注意香农指出的一个实际结果。由于英语的冗余度约为 50%，如果要通过无噪声信道进行传输，通过适当的编码过程可以节省普通电报时间的一半左右。但是，当信道上有噪声时，不使用消除所有冗余的编码过程确实有好处。因为剩余的冗余有助于对抗噪声。这是很容易看到的，因为正因为英语的冗余度很高，人们几乎不会或毫不犹豫地纠正传输过程中出现的拼写错误。

One practical consequence, pointed out by Shannon, should be noted. Since English is about 50 per cent redundant, it would be possible to save about one-half the time of ordinary telegraphy by a proper encoding process, provided one were going to transmit over a noiseless channel. When there is noise on a channel, however, there is some real advantage in not using a coding process that eliminates all of the redundancy. For the remaining redundancy helps combat the noise. This is very easy to see, for just because of the fact that the redundancy of English is high, one has, for example, little or no hesitation about correcting errors in spelling that have arisen during transmission.

2.6. 连续消息

2.6. Continuous Messages

到目前为止，我们关注的都是由离散符号组成的信息，例如单词由字母组成，句子由单词组成，旋律由音符组成，或者由有限数量的离散点组成的半色调图像。如果我们考虑连续信息，例如说话的声音，其音调和能量会连续变化，那么理论会发生什么变化呢？

Up to this point we have been concerned with messages formed out of discrete symbols, as words are formed of letters, sentences of words, a melody of notes, or a halftone picture of a finite number of discrete spots. What happens to the theory if one considers continuous messages, such as the speaking voice with its continuous variation of pitch and energy?

粗略地说，扩展理论在数学上稍微困难和复杂一些，但本质上并没有不同。上述离散情况的许多陈述不需要修改，其他陈述只需要稍作修改。

Very roughly one may say that the extended theory is somewhat more difficult and complicated mathematically, but not essentially different. Many of the above statements for the discrete case require no modification, and others require only minor change.

有一种情况对我们有很大的帮助。实际上，人们总是对连续信号感兴趣，这种信号不是由所有频率的简单谐波成分组成的，而是由完全位于从零频率到每秒W个周期的频率范围内的频率组成的。因此，尽管人类的声音确实包含更高的频率，仅能处理频率高达四千的电话信道就能实现非常令人满意的通信。频率高达一万或一万二千的电话信道就能实现高保真度的无线电传输交响乐，等等。

One circumstance which helps a good deal is the following. As a practical matter, one is always interested in a continuous signal which is built up of simple harmonic constituents of not all frequencies, but rather of frequencies which lie wholly within a band from zero frequency to, say, a frequency of W cycles per second. Thus although the human voice does contain higher frequencies, very satisfactory communication can be achieved over a telephone channel that handles frequencies only up to, say four thousand. With frequencies up to ten or twelve thousand, high fidelity radio transmission of symphonic music is possible, etc.

有一个非常方便的数学定理，它指出，一个持续时间为T秒、频率带宽限制在 0 到W范围内的连续信号，可以通过陈述 2TW个数字来完全指定。这真是一个了不起的定理。通常，连续曲线只能通过陈述它经过的任意有限数量的点来近似地表征，而要获得有关曲线的完整信息，通常需要无限数量的点。但如果曲线是由有限数量频率的简单谐波成分构成的，就像复杂声音是由有限数量的纯音构成的一样，那么有限数量的参数就是所需的全部参数。这具有强大的优势，可以将连续信号的通信问题的特征从必须处理无限数量变量的复杂情况简化为处理有限（但数量很大）变量的相当简单的情况。

There is a very convenient mathematical theorem which states that a continuous signal, T seconds in duration and band-limited in frequency to the range from 0 to W, can be completely specified by stating 2TW numbers. This is really a remarkable theorem. Ordinarily a continuous curve can be only approximately characterized by stating any finite number of points through which it passes, and an infinite number would in general be required for complete information about the curve. But if the curve is built up out of simple harmonic constituents of a limited number of frequencies, as a complex sound is built up out of a limited number of pure tones, then a finite number of parameters is all that is necessary. This has the powerful advantage of reducing the character of the communication problem for continuous signals from a complieated situation where one would have to deal with an infinite number of variables to a considerably simpler situation where one deals with a finite (though large) number of variables.

在连续情况下的理论中，有公式描述带宽为W的信道的最大容量C ，当传输中使用的平均功率为P时，信道受到功率为 N 的噪声的影响，这种噪声是香农定义的一种特殊类型的“白热噪声”。这种白热噪声本身的频率带宽有限，各种频率成分的幅度服从正态（高斯）概率分布。在这种情况下，香农得出了定理，该定理同样非常简单，适用范围也非常广泛，即通过最佳编码，可以以每秒 10 ...

In the theory for the continuous case there are developed formulas which describe the maximum capacity C of a channel of frequency bandwidth W, when the average power used in transmitting is P, the channel being subject to a noise of power N, this noise being “white thermal noise” of a special kind which Shannon defines. This white thermal noise is itself band limited in frequency, and the amplitudes of the various frequency constituents are subject to a normal (Gaussian) probability distribution. Under these circumstances, Shannon obtains the theorem, again really quite remarkable in its simplicity and its scope, that it is possible, by the best coding, to transmit binary digits at the rate of

每秒传输的比特数为 1000，错误发生频率任意低。但无论编码多么巧妙，这个速率都不可能超过，否则就会产生一定的错误频率。对于任意噪声的情况，而不是特殊的“白噪声”，考虑到上述假设的“热”噪声，香农未能成功推导出信道容量的一个明确公式，但确实获得了信道容量的有用上限和下限。他还推导出当指定的不是发射机的平均功率而是峰值瞬时功率时信道容量的极限。

bits per second and have an arbitrarily low frequency of error. But this rate cannot possibly be exceeded, no matter how clever the coding, without giving rise to a definite frequency of errors. For the case of arbitrary noise, rather than the special “white thermal” noise assumed above, Shannon does not succeed in deriving one explicit formula for channel capacity, but does obtain useful upper and lower limits for channel capacity. And he also derives limits for channel capacity when one specifies not the average power of the transmitter, but rather the peak instantaneous power.

最后应该指出的是，香农获得的结果必然不那么具体，但显然具有深刻而广泛的意义，对于一般的连续消息或信号来说，这些结果表征了接收消息的保真度，以及源产生信息的速率、传输速率和信道容量的概念，所有这些都与一定的保真度要求有关。

Finally it should be stated that Shannon obtains results which are necessarily somewhat less specific, but which are of obviously deep and sweeping significance, which, for a general sort of continuous message or signal, characterize the fidelity of the received message, and the concepts of rate at which a source generates information, rate of transmission, and channel capacity, all of these being relative to certain fidelity requirements.

3

3

三个层次的沟通问题的相互关系

The Interrelationship of the Three Levels of Communication Problems

3.1. 介绍

3.1. Introductory

本文第一部分提出，人们可以从三个层面来考虑一般的沟通问题。也就是说，人们可以问：

In the first section of this paper it was suggested that there are three levels at which one may consider the general communication problem. Namely, one may ask:

级别A. 通信符号的传输准确度如何？

LEVEL A. How accurately can the symbols of communication be transmitted?

级别B.所传输的符号如何精确地传达所需的含义？

LEVEL B. How precisely do the transmitted symbols convey the desired meaning?

级别C. 接受到的含义如何有效地以期望的方式影响行为？

LEVEL C. How effectively does the received meaning affect conduct in the desired way?

有人认为，香农、维纳等人发展的通信数学理论，特别是香农处理的更明确的工程理论，虽然表面上只适用于 A 级问题，但实际上对 B 级和 C 级问题有帮助和启发。

It was suggested that the mathematical theory of communication, as developed by Shannon, Wiener, and others, and particularly the more definitely engineering theory treated by Shannon, although ostensibly applicable only to Level A problems, actually is helpful and suggestive for the level B and C problems.

然后，我们在第 2 节中研究了这个数学理论是什么、它发展了哪些概念、它取得了哪些成果。本结论部分的目的是回顾这一情况，看看原始部分在多大程度上和在哪些方面有理由表明在 A 级取得的进展能够促进 B 级和 C 级，有理由表明这三个级别的相互关系如此之大，以至于人们的最终结论可能是将这三个级别分开确实是人为的和不可取的。

We then took a look, in section 2, at what this mathematical theory is, what concepts it develops, what results it has obtained. It is the purpose of this concluding section to review the situation, and see to what extent and in what terms the original section was justified in indicating that the progress made at Level A is capable of contributing to levels B and C, was justified in indicating that the interrelation of the three levels is so considerable that one's final conclusion may be that the separation into the three levels is really artificial and undesirable.

3.2. A 级理论的普遍性

3.2. Generality of the Theory at Level A

显而易见的第一点，实际上也是承载着论证主要负担的评论，是数学理论在其范围上具有极其普遍性，在其所处理的问题上具有根本性，在其所得结果上具有经典的简单性和强大性。

The obvious first remark, and indeed the remark that carries the major burden of the argument, is that the mathematical theory is exceedingly general in its scope, fundamental in the problems it treats, and of classic simplicity and power in the results it reaches.

这个理论非常普遍，以至于我们不需要说明所考虑的符号类型——是书面字母还是单词，是音符还是口语，是交响乐还是图片。这个理论非常深奥，以至于它揭示的关系可以不加区别地应用于所有这些以及其他形式的交流。当然，这意味着这个理论具有足够的想象力，因此它处理的是交流问题的真正内核——那些无论实际情况采取何种特殊形式，都普遍适用的基本关系。

This is a theory so general that one does not need to say what kinds of symbols are being considered—whether written letters or words, or musical notes, or spoken words, or symphonic music, or pictures. The theory is deep enough so that the relationships it reveals indiscriminately apply to all these and to other forms of communication. This means, of course, that the theory is sufficiently imaginatively motivated so that it is dealing with the real inner core of the communication problem—with those basic relationships which hold in general, no matter what special form the actual case may take.

正是这种普遍性的证据表明，该理论对密码学做出了重要贡献，事实上它确实是密码学的基本理论，而密码学当然是一种编码形式。同样，该理论也有助于解决从一种语言到另一种语言的翻译问题，尽管这里的完整故事显然需要考虑意义和信息。同样，这项工作中提出的想法与大型计算机的逻辑设计问题紧密相关，因此香农刚刚写了一篇关于设计一台能够熟练下棋的计算机的论文也就不足为奇了。与目前的争论直接相关的是，这篇论文的结尾评论说，要么人们必须说这样的计算机“思考”，要么人们必须说计算机“思考”。必须大幅修改动词“思考”的传统含义。

It is an evidence of this generality that the theory contributes importantly to, and in fact is really the basic theory of cryptography which is, of course, a form of coding. In a similar way, the theory contributes to the problem of translation from one language to another, although the complete story here clearly requires consideration of meaning, as well as of information. Similarly, the ideas developed in this work connect so closely with the problem of the logical design of great computers that it is no surprise that Shannon has just written a paper on the design of a computer which would be capable of playing a skillful game of chess. And it is of further direct pertinence to the present contention that this paper closes with the remark that either one must say that such a computer “thinks,” or one must substantially modify the conventional implication of the verb “to think.”

第二点，显然，本理论所基于的形式化对任何可能的一般通信理论都做出了重要贡献。乍一看，按照本理论的开篇方式绘制通信系统图似乎显而易见；但这种情况的分解必须非常合理和恰当，因为当人们看到这种观点如何顺利而普遍地引出核心问题时，就会深信不疑。考虑 B 级和 C 级通信几乎肯定需要在第 7 页的示意图上添加内容，但同样可能的是，只需要添加少量内容，而不需要进行真正的修改。

As a second point, it seems clear that an important contribution has been made to any possible general theory of communication by the formalization on which the present theory is based. It seems at first obvious to diagram a communication system as it is done at the outset of this theory; but this breakdown of the situation must be very deeply sensible and appropriate, as one becomes convinced when he sees how smoothly and generally this viewpoint leads to central issues. It is almost certainly true that a consideration of communication on levels B and C will require additions to the schematic diagram on page 7, but it seems equally likely that what is required are minor additions, and no real revision.

因此，当人们进入 B 级和 C 级时，考虑目的地的统计特征可能是必不可少的。人们可以想象，作为图表的补充，在工程接收器（将信号转换为消息）和目的地之间插入另一个标记为“语义接收器”的框。这个语义接收器对消息进行第二次解码，对这次解码的要求是，它必须将消息的统计语义特征与所有接收器的统计语义能力相匹配，或者与构成人们希望影响的受众的接收器子集的统计语义能力相匹配。

Thus when one moves to levels B and C, it may prove to be essential to take account of the statistical characteristics of the destination. One can imagine, as an addition to the diagram, another box labeled “Semantic Receiver” interposed between the engineering receiver (which changes signals to messages) and the destination. This semantic receiver subjects the message to a second decoding, the demand on this one being that it must match the statistical semantic characteristics of the message to the statistical semantic capacities of the totality of receivers, or of that subset of receivers which constitute the audience one wishes to affect.

同样，我们可以想象在图中插入另一个框，该框位于信息源和发送器之间，将被标记为“语义噪声”，之前标记为“噪声”的框现在被标记为“工程噪声”。来自该源的信号被强加到信号中，这些扰动或扭曲的含义并非源所期望的，但不可避免地会影响目的地。语义解码问题必须考虑到这种语义噪声。也可以考虑调整原始消息，使消息含义加上语义噪声的总和等于目的地所需的总消息含义。

Similarly one can imagine another box in the diagram which, inserted between the information source and the transmitter, would be labeled “semantic noise,” the box previously labeled as simply “noise” now being labeled “engineering noise.” From this source is imposed into the signal the perturbations or distortions of meaning which are not intended by the source but which inescapably affect the destination. And the problem of semantic decoding must take this semantic noise into account. It is also possible to think of an adjustment of original message so that the sum of message meaning plus semantic noise is equal to the desired total message meaning at the destination.

第三，无论编码有多好，当人们试图将太多的内容集中在一个特定的内容上时，似乎在各个层面上都存在这样的问题：错误和混乱的出现，保真度的降低。渠道（即H > C）。同样，所有级别的一般理论肯定不仅要考虑渠道的容量，还要考虑（甚至用词都是正确的！）观众的容量。如果一个人试图让观众的容量过于拥挤，那么根据直接类比，你可能不会让观众坐满，然后只会浪费剩余的观众。更有可能的是，同样根据直接类比，如果你让观众的容量过于拥挤，你就会引发普遍的、不可避免的错误和混乱。

Thirdly, it seems highly suggestive for the problem at all levels that error and confusion arise and fidelity decreases, when, no matter how good the coding, one tries to crowd too much over a channel (i.e., H > C). Here again a general theory at all levels will surely have to take into account not only the capacity of the channel but also (even the words are right!) the capacity of the audience. If one tries to overcrowd the capacity of the audience, it is probably true, by direct analogy, that you do not, so to speak, fill the audience up and then waste only the remainder by spilling. More likely, and again by direct analogy, if you overcrowd the capacity of the audience you force a general and inescapable error and confusion.

第四，很难相信 B 级和 C 级没有太多值得学习的地方，也没有找到有用的方法来处理他们的问题，即该理论中与信息概念相关的熵思想的发展。

Fourthly, it is hard to believe that levels B and C do not have much to learn from, and do not have the approach to their problems usefully oriented by, the development in this theory of the entropic ideas in relation to the concept of information.

该理论中发展的信息概念乍一看似乎令人失望和奇怪——令人失望是因为它与意义无关；奇怪是因为它处理的不是单个信息，而是整个信息集合的统计特征；奇怪还因为在这些统计术语中，信息和不确定性这两个词是伙伴。

The concept of information developed in this theory at first seems disappointing and bizarre—disappointing because it has nothing to do with meaning, and bizarre because it deals not with a single message but rather with the statistical character of a whole ensemble of messages, bizarre also because in these statistical terms the two words information and uncertainty find themselves to be partners.

然而，我认为这些只是暂时的反应；最后，我们应该说，这种分析已经如此深刻地澄清了事实，以至于我们现在，也许是第一次，已经准备好接受真正的意义理论。工程通信理论就像一个非常得体和谨慎的女孩接受你的电报。她不注意电报的含义，无论是悲伤、快乐还是尴尬。但她必须准备好处理所有到达她办公桌上的信息。这种想法认为，通信系统应该尝试处理所有可能的消息，而明智的尝试方式是根据源的统计特性进行设计，这对于一般的通信来说肯定不是没有意义。语言必须从人类可能希望表达的所有事物的角度来设计（或开发）；但由于语言无法完成所有事情，它也应该尽可能多地做好。也就是说，它也应该从统计的角度来处理它的任务。

I think, however, that these should be only temporary reactions; and that one should say, at the end, that this analysis has so penetratingly cleared the air that one is now, perhaps for the first time, ready for a real theory of meaning. An engineering communication theory is just like a very proper and discreet girl accepting your telegram. She pays no attention to the meaning, whether it be sad, or joyous, or embarrassing. But she must be prepared to deal with all that come to her desk. This idea that a communication system ought to try to deal with all possible messages, and that the intelligent way to try is to base design on the statistical character of the source, is surely not without significance for communication in general. Language must be designed (or developed) with a view to the totality of things that man may wish to say; but not being able to accomplish everything, it too should do as well as possible as often as possible. That is to say, it too should deal with its task statistically.

正如我们所见，与来源相关的信息的概念直接导致了对语言统计结构的研究；这项研究揭示了英语，例如，对于语言和交流各个阶段的学生来说，信息似乎都很重要。利用马尔可夫过程的强大理论体系似乎对语义研究特别有前景，因为该理论特别适合处理意义中最重要但最困难的方面之一，即上下文的影响。人们隐约感觉到，信息和意义可能被证明类似于量子理论中的一对规范共轭变量，它们受到某种联合限制，这种限制迫使一个人牺牲其中一个变量，因为他坚持拥有另一个变量。

The concept of the information to be associated with a source leads directly, as we have seen, to a study of the statistical structure of language; and this study reveals about the English language, as an example, information which seems surely significant to students of every phase of language and communication. The idea of utilizing the powerful body of theory concerning Markoff processes seems particularly promising for semantic studies, since this theory is specifically adapted to handle one of the most significant but difficult aspects of meaning, namely the influence of context. One has the vague feeling that information and meaning may prove to be something like a pair of canonically conjugate variables in quantum theory, they being subject to some joint restriction that condemns a person to the sacrifice of the one as he insists on having much of the other.

或者，意义可能被证明类似于热力学集合的熵所依赖的量之一。正如前面提到的，熵在理论中的出现无疑是最有趣和最有意义的。爱丁顿已经在这方面被引用过，但《物理世界的本质》中还有另一段话似乎特别恰当和富有启发性：

Or perhaps meaning may be shown to be analogous to one of the quantities on which the entropy of a thermodynamic ensemble depends. The appearance of entropy in the theory, as was remarked earlier, is surely most interesting and significant. Eddington has already been quoted in this connection, but there is another passage in “The Nature of the Physical World” which seems particularly apt and suggestive:

假设我们被要求将以下事物分为两类：距离、质量、电力、熵、美、旋律。
Suppose that we were asked to arrange the following in two categories—distance, mass, electric force, entropy, beauty, melody.
我认为，有充分的理由将熵与美和旋律并列，而不是与前三者并列。只有在将各部分关联起来观察时，才会发现熵，而美和旋律正是通过观察或聆听各部分关联起来才能辨别出来。这三者都是排列的特征。这三个关联中的一个应该能够作为科学的常见量，这是一个很有启发性的想法。这个陌生人之所以能在物理世界的原住民中脱颖而出，是因为它能够说他们的语言，即算术语言。
I think there are the strongest grounds for placing entropy alongside beauty and melody, and not with the first three. Entropy is only found when the parts are viewed in association, and it is by viewing or hearing the parts in association that beauty and melody are discerned. All three are features of arrangement. It is a pregnant thought that one of these three associates should be able to figure as a commonplace quantity of science. The reason why this stranger can pass itself off among the aborigines of the physical world is that it is able to speak their language, viz., the language of arithmetic.

我确信爱丁顿愿意将“意义”这个词与“美感”和“旋律”结合起来；我想，他会很高兴地看到，在这个理论中，熵不仅用算术的语言表达，还用语言的语言表达。

I feel sure that Eddington would have been willing to include the word meaning along with beauty and melody; and I suspect he would have been thrilled to see, in this theory, that entropy not only speaks the language of arithmetic; it also speaks the language of language.

1本文分为三个主要部分。第一部分和第三部分，WW 负责思想和形式。中间部分，即“2) A 级通信问题”，是对贝尔电话实验室的 Claude E. Shannon 博士的数学论文的解释。正如冯·诺依曼所指出的，香农博士的工作可以追溯到玻尔兹曼在其统计物理学著作 (1894) 中的观察，即熵与“缺失信息”有关，因为它与在记录了有关物理系统的所有宏观可观察信息后，该系统剩余的可能替代方案的数量有关。L. Szilard（Zsch. f. Phys. Vol. 53, 1925）将这一思想扩展到物理学中信息的一般讨论，而冯·诺依曼（Math. Foundation of Quantum Mechanics, Berlin, 1932, Chap. V）则处理了量子力学和粒子物理学中的信息。香农博士的工作与贝尔实验室的 H.
